content.question: Which of the following bonds represented in the diagram above is the most polar?

choices.label: <math alttext="C, C l single bond" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi>Cl</mi></math>
<math alttext="C, I single bond" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math>
<math alttext="C, H single bond" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>
<math alttext="C, B r single bond" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi>Br</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="C, C l single bond" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi>Cl</mi></math>

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
